questions: Q. 1. Why was States Reorganization Commission formed ? [Board Term-I, Term-I, Set  2016-17]
answers: Ans. States Reorganization Commission was formed in 1954 to recommend creation of States on the linguistic basis.  1

questions: Q. 2. How do the Central and State Governments enjoy their power in federal system ?
answers: Ans. Under the unitary system, either there is only one level of government or the sub-units are subordinate to the central government whereas in federal power is distributed between centre  1 and state.

questions: Q. 3. Name the country which follows ‘coming together’ style of federalism. [Board Term-I, Term-I, Set KVS-2014, DDE-2014]
Q. 4. Which subjects are included in the Union List ?
answers: Ans. Defence of the nation, foreign affairs, banking, currency,, communication. currency communic ation.

questions: Q. 5. Which type of government has two or more levels ?
Q. 6. Which subjects falls under the concurrent list ?
answers: Ans. Marriage, education, forest, trade unions, adoption and succession.

questions: Q. 7. The subject of Computer Software comes under which list ?
Q. 8. In case of any dispute about the division of powers who can make a decision ?
answers: Ans. The High Court and the Supreme Court can make a decision.

questions: Q. 9. Which subjects are included in the State list ?
answers: Ans. Agriculture, police, public health, land.

questions: Q. 10. Which groups of countries are an example of holding together federation ?
Q. 11. The federal system serves which two dual objectives ?
answers: Ans. First, to safeguard and promote unity of the country and secondly, to accommodate regional diversity.1
